snippet: Lawmakers amended the law three weeks after the United States announced plans to suspend Bangladesh’s trade privileges over labor rights and safety violations in factories.
abstract: Bangladeshi lawmakers, facing intense international pressure to improve conditions for garment workers, amend country's labor law; say it is landmark strengthening of workers' protections, but rights groups argue that law makes only modest changes and undercuts unions.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers amended the law three weeks after the United States announced plans to suspend Bangladesh’s trade privileges over labor rights and safety violations in factories.

headline.main: Under Pressure, Bangladesh Adopts New Labor Law
